details.script_description: This script uses SLURM to run a prediction task using a BERT model on a specified dataset. It defines resources such as nodes, tasks, CPUs, memory, GPUs, and time limits. It sets up the environment by loading necessary modules, installing packages, and exporting environment variables. The script then runs a Python script called 'run_ner_consensus.py' with various command-line arguments, including the path to the model directory, dataset directory, and other configurations. The script outputs the results in a specified directory and generates a summary of the results.
